overview:
Moty Ben-Arie has an extensive technology background an vast experience as both an entrepreneur and an investor.

Moty spent five years as a General Partner at Walden Israel Venture Capital. He was involved in numerous investments, including Passave Technologies, Lynx Photonic Networks, Colorchip, Camero, Lenslet Labs and Aminon. He was a founder of Radcom, a communications company originally funded by the RAD group of companies and led the company from the start-up stage to its IPO on NASDAQ. Prior to joining Radcom, Moty managed a series of interdisciplinary research and development projects in Elisra, an Israeli manufacturer of communications equipment and military electronics. Moty served as an electronic engineer with the Israeli Navy. Moti Ben-Arie holds a B.Sc. in Electronic Engineering from the Technion and an M.B.A from Tel-Aviv University.
